intro: Crotalaria eurycalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
